pageContext.claim: “We actually had Obamacare totally repealed and replaced, we couldn't get one Democrat vote, not one. … And it's been very much dismantled, but it will be ultimately totally dismantled. We had it done, we were a little disappointed in one vote.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was not one vote away from repealing and replacing Obamacare. A bare-bones GOP plan called "skinny repeal" failed in the Senate by one vote, but that bill did not match what the House had approved. There was no guarantee that the House and Senate would have been able to come up with a compromise measure at conference. Furthemore, while Trump successfully repealed Obamacare's individual mandate, most of the law remains in place. It is not "very much dismantled."
